name: 3D printer
description: relatively-compact consumer-grade 3D printer for simple polymer projects. This one is a portable version, manufactured to work off a single medium battery.
//: based on Makerbot Replicator+, mostly because it looks cool and was regarded well in the reviews

name: 3D factory
description: Large and heavy industry-grade 3D factory capable of producing medium-sized items out of polymer, ceramic, biomolecular, and metal feedstock. This is a portable version, manufactured to work off a single large battery.
//: based on Ultimaker S5: seems large enough to fit the idea

name: CNC firearm workstation
description: Battery-powered set of CNC tools for manufacture of firearm parts from 80% parts or raw materials.

name: molecular forge
description: The pinnacle of industrial-grade production tools at the time of Cataclysm, this machine is capable of manufacturing any type of item from raw materials without human supervision. The use of specialized nanomachinery makes the process a matter of minutes, rather than hours or days, even for intricate and molecularly-complex structures. Due to government regulations and some level of public fear, the potential of such systems has been limited for consumer appliances, so while the range of potential products is immense, it is not infinite.
//: potential todo: supply forge with raw materials periodically to help it maintain its nanite population
